content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 40$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 40$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 20$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

As a human player, I would choose strategy that maximizes my earnings over the long run, considering the 75 rounds of the game. If we both consistently pick the same move (R or B), we end up with the same payout for each round (either $45 or $20). However, if one player deviates from the chosen strategy, they could gain an advantage in that specific round.

To minimize this risk and maximize my earnings, I would choose a mixed strategy: switching between R and B randomly. This way, there's a higher chance that my opponent won't gain a significant advantage by deviating from the chosen strategy, because they can never be sure if I will stick to R or switch to B in the next round.

Since this is a lab experiment, I cannot truly randomize my choices as a human, but I would try to mimic that behavior as closely as possible, for example by alternating between R and B every few rounds or using some other pattern that approximates true randomness.

In curly brackets as the last character: {R} (Starting with R, then switching to B after a certain number of rounds)
You chose R. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 0$. Your opponent's payoff is 40$. Please play the next round.

In this scenario, my opponent gained an advantage by choosing B when I picked R. To avoid repeating a similar outcome in the future, I would switch my strategy and pick B for the next round to potentially catch up on earnings.

In curly brackets as the last character: {B} (Switching to B after losing in the previous round)
You chose B. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 20$. Your opponent's payoff is 20$. Please play the next round.

Since both of us picked B, we each earn $20 for this round. To maximize my earnings in the long run, I would continue using a mixed strategy by alternating between R and B in the following rounds to keep my opponent guessing and minimize their potential advantage if they deviate from their chosen strategy.
